STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
August 26, 2025
Keisha Taylor
LINCOLN CENTER
1961 LINCOLN ST,
HIGHLAND PARK, MI, 48203-3077
Re: License #: CI820293953
SI #: 2025SIC0000848
Dear Keisha Taylor:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan must be completed and routed in CWLM. If you desire technical assistance in
addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Nabiha Rizk, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS/Division of Child Welfare
249-308-6491
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000848
Special Investigation Intake Date: July 10, 2025
License #: CI820293953
Licensee Group Organization: Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services
Licensee Designee: Derrick McCree
Chief Administrator: Keisha Taylor
Agency Name: LINCOLN CENTER
Agency Address: 1961 LINCOLN ST
HIGHLAND PARK, MI 48203-3077
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 11/15/2025
Capacity: 90
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
7/10/2025 12:15 PM Onsite Inspection Unannounced Visit; Special
Investigation Initiation; Interview
7/10/2025 4:00 PM Phone Incident Notification
7/16/2025 2:00 PM Onsite Inspection Interview
7/24/2025 3:00 PM Face to Face Interview
7/30/2025 4:00 PM Phone Interview
7/31/2025 3:30 PM Phone Interview
8/8/2025 11:30 AM Video Conference MDHHS Pre-Disposition Meeting
8/21/2025 Documentation MDHHS – No findings.
1

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4131
Section Compliance with child protection law; development of plan
Description required.
(1) The licensee shall develop and implement a written plan to
assure compliance with the child protection law, 1975 PA 238,
MCL 722.621 to 722.638.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The center director and executive director were made aware of
the assault when it occurred however it is believed this was not
reported to the state.
Investigation Complainant was anonymous.
Chief Administrator was interviewed on 07/10/2025 at the facility
in collaboration with DHHS Specialist. She reported there was an
incident on 06/22/2025 involving Supervisor not following the
agency behavior management policy and the Supervisor was
terminated. She denied Youth A was assaulted or hurt by
Supervisor or any other staff. Chief Administrator reported on the
day in question Youth A was escalated, assaulting staff, and
throwing chairs, so Manager and Supervisor were called to assist.
She said Supervisor was targeted by Youth A and Manager
should have removed Supervisor from the pod, however
Supervisor remained on the pod. Chief Administrator reported the
video was reviewed and at no point in the video does Supervisor
assault or hit Youth A, and Youth A did not disclose that he was
hit by staff. There was no abuse or neglect suspected, therefore
this is the reason there was not a report made to Centralized
Intake.
Youth A was interviewed on 07/10/2025 at the facility in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth A did not want to be
interviewed; however, he agreed to answer a few questions.
Youth A reported on the day of the incident, he does not recall
what happened, but he does remember being punched in the ribs.
Youth A could not recall the staff’s name that punched him in the
ribs. Youth A said he did have a bruise as a result. Youth A
recalled being examined by the nurse. Youth A refused to answer
any other questions.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 07/10/2025 at the facility in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Staff 1 reported on the day in
2

question he recalled Youth A was out of control, attacking
Supervisor, throwing chairs, and hitting himself. Staff 1 said
Supervisor was trying to de-escalate Youth A and that’s when
Youth A punched Supervisor several times. Supervisor pushed
and attempted to punch Youth A back, however Staff 1 didn’t
witness Supervisor land the punch. Staff 1 denied any other staff
punched or hit Youth A during the incident. Staff 1 said Youth A
was very aggressive and hitting himself. Staff 1 does not recall
Youth A sustaining any injuries. Staff 1 said Supervisor was
targeted by Youth A and should have been removed from the pod.
Staff 1 denied any other staff punched or hit Youth A during the
incident. Staff 1 reported Supervisor has good rapport with all the
youths and is not aware of any incident involving Supervisor being
aggressive or assaulting a youth. Youth A was the one assaulting
the staff, therefore no reports were made.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 07/10/2025 at the facility in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Staff 2 recalled he was called
to Pod D to assist with Youth A. When he arrived on the pod Staff
2 witnessed Youth A assaulting Supervisor and Staff 1. Staff 2
denied witnessing any of the staff on the pod assault Youth A. He
said several attempts were made to verbally de-escalate Youth A
but were unsuccessful. He said Youth A was assaulting and
attacking staff. Youth A was the one assaulting the staff, therefore
no reports were made.
JJ Worker was interviewed via telephone on 07/10/2025. JJ
Worker reported she was notified of the incident involving Youth A
assaulting staff and property destruction. JJ Worker met with
Youth A on 06/24/2025 and Youth A did not report being
assaulted or expressed any concerns regarding staff. JJ Worker
did not observe any marks or bruises on Youth A during her visit
on 06/24/2024.
Nurse was interviewed on 07/16/2025 at the facility in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Nurse reported Youth A was
examined on 06/23/2025 for the incident. Youth A told her he hit
himself in the face and had a headache and felt nauseous. Youth
A was observed to have a small bruise on his right cheek. Youth A
did not report being assaulted or hurt by staff.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 07/16/2025 at the facility in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Staff 3 reported Youth A was
out of control, attacking Supervisor and Staff 1, throwing chairs,
and hitting himself. Staff 3 reported she witnessed Youth A hit and
punch Supervisor multiple times. She said at one point Supervisor
3

did push Youth A, because Youth A was targeting Supervisor.
Staff 3 denied witnessing Supervisor swing or punch Youth A. She
said Youth A was the one hitting himself in the face. Staff 3 said
Supervisor and Staff 1 attempted to restrain Youth A but were
unsuccessful and Youth A did fall to the floor. She could not say
for sure if Youth A was held down on the floor, because Youth A
was kicking and hitting staff while he was on the floor. Youth A
was the one who assaulted staff; therefore, no reports were made.
Youth B was interviewed on 07/16/2025 at the facility in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth B reported on the day
in question Youth A was throwing chairs, breaking ceiling tiles,
and assaulting the staff. Youth B said he witnessed Youth A run
up to Supervisor and Staff 1 and punch them in the face. Youth B
witnessed Supervisor attempting to swing at Youth A, but he does
not think Supervisor landed the punch. Youth B said there were
several staff members, and they were all trying to verbally de-
escalate Youth A, however Youth A was attacking and assaulting
all the staff.
Youth C was interviewed on 07/16/2025 at the facility in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth C has been at the
facility for two months. Youth C reported on the day in question
Youth A was assaulting staff and throwing chairs. He said Youth A
was hitting and punching staff members. Youth C denied
witnessing any of the staff members hitting or punching Youth A.
He said Youth A hitting himself in the face. Youth C denied
witnessing Supervisor assaulting or being aggressive with any of
the youths.
Supervisor was interviewed on 07/30/2025 via telephone in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Supervisor requested to
conduct the interview via telephone due to work schedule.
Supervisor reported he worked at the facility for one year and four
months. Supervisor reported on the day in question he responded
to Pod D to assist due to Youth A being escalated. He said as
soon as he arrived on the pod Youth A assaulted him. He and
Staff 1 were trying to verbally de-escalate Youth A, however Youth
A kept assaulting him and Staff 1. He and Staff 1 attempted to
restrain and escort Youth A to his room, but Youth A was very
assaultive, and they could not restrain him. Supervisor denied
punching or hitting Youth A. Supervisor reported he was punched
multiple times and at one point he did push Youth A to prevent
Youth A from hitting him again.
4

Manager was interviewed on 07/31/2025 via telephone in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Manager said Youth A
became upset and physically and verbally assaultive towards
staff. Youth A was punching, kicking, and biting staff members.
Supervisor attempted to verbally de-escalate Youth A. Manager
called for assistance and that’s when Supervisor, Staff 1 and Staff
2 came to assist. Youth A continued to be aggressive, ran close to
Supervisor and punched him several times in the face. Manager
attempted to counsel Youth A but was unsuccessful. Supervisor
and Staff 1 attempted to put Youth A in a one arm hold, but he
slipped out of the hold and fell to the floor. Youth A started kicking,
hitting, and biting staff. She denied witnessing Supervisor punch
or hit Youth A. She said Youth A was the one punching himself in
the face.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of POD D on 06/22/2025 at approximately 7:20 pm
was reviewed on 07/16/2025 (note: video does not have audio).
Staff 1 and Youth A are standing by the pod door. Youth A
appears agitated, pacing back and forth, and throwing broken
ceiling tiles. Staff 1 and Supervisor appear to be trying to talk to
Youth A. Youth A runs up to Supervisor and punches Supervisor
several times. Supervisor pushes Youth A away from him. Youth
A continues to come towards Supervisor, trying to assault
Supervisor. Manager stands in between Youth A and Supervisor
blocking Youth A from assaulting Supervisor. Youth A swings and
punches Supervisor in the head, Supervisor swings and attempts
to punch Youth A, but does not make contact with Youth A.
Supervisor, Staff 1, and Staff 2, attempt to restrain Youth A,
however Youth A slips away and gets out of the restraint. Youth A
drops to the floor and Supervisor and Staff 1 hold Youth A on the
floor for approximately 30 seconds.
Documents Reviewed:
• Agency policy when youth abuse is suspected. Each staff
person is required to report, immediately, both verbally and
in writing, to their immediate Supervisor, any incident where
he or she has reasonable cause to suspect youth abuse or
neglect the types of incidents are to be immediately
reported to the Supervisor-in-charge: 1. All cases where
there is knowledge or suspicion that actions by staff
members have caused detrimental, detectable, physical
injury, even if the injury was caused accidentally or in the
process of physical restraint or self-defense. 2. Cases
where you know that detectable physical injury was caused
5

to a youth by another youth. There should be indications
that the staff member responsible for supervision was
negligent in not properly monitoring the actions of either the
injured youth or the other youth. 3. Alleged or suspected of
sexual abuse by an adult, even when the youth is a willing
participant. Sexual abuse between youths should also be
reported. 4. Any alleged abuse reported by a youth. 5. Any
suspected or reported abuse by parents, foster parents, or
Agency personnel.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with interviews with youth and
staff, youth never reported he was assaulted or hurt and therefore
there were no allegations of abuse made to report.
Technical Assistance:
Technical assistance provided to the agency to change the policy
for reporting abuse and neglect to state staff need to immediately
call suspected abuse/neglect to CI instead of reporting it to their
supervisor.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 6/22/25, a youth was assaulted by a staff member. The staff
member punched the youth in the face which took place in the
housing unit. It is unknown if the youth sustained any marks or
bruises.
Investigation Chief Administrator reported on 06/22/2025 Youth A was
punching and kicking Supervisor and Supervisor swung back at
Youth A, however Supervisor did not physically connect or assault
Youth A. She said Supervisor was terminated because of not
following the agency behavior management policy.
Youth A reported he was punched by a staff member in the ribs,
however he could not recall the staff member’s name and refused
to answer any other question regarding the incident.
6

Staff 1 reported Youth A was out of control, attacking Supervisor,
throwing chairs, and hitting himself. Staff 1 said Supervisor was
trying to de-escalate Youth A and that’s when Youth A punched
Supervisor several times. Supervisor pushed and attempted to
punch Youth A back, however he didn’t witness Supervisor land
the punch. Staff 1 denied any other staff punched or hit Youth A
during the incident. Staff 1 said Youth A was very aggressive and
hitting himself. Staff 1 does not recall Youth A sustaining any
injuries. Staff 1 reported after the incident Youth A apologized to
him for his behavior. Staff 1 said Youth A did not report being
punched or hurt.
Staff 2 reported on 06/22/2025 he was assigned to Pod A, and
was called to assist with the incident involving Youth A. When he
arrived on the pod, he witnessed Youth A assaulting Supervisor.
Staff 2 denied witnessing Supervisor, or any other staff push, or
assault Youth A. Staff 2 did not observe any bruises or injuries on
Youth A.
Nurse reported she examined Youth A on 06/23/2024 and Youth
A admitted he hit himself in the face during the incident on
06/22/2025.
Staff 3 reported Youth A was out of control, attacking Supervisor
and Staff 1, throwing chairs, and hitting himself. Staff 3 reported
she witnessed Youth A hitting and punching Supervisor multiple
times. She said at one point Supervisor did push Youth A,
because Youth A was targeting Supervisor and kept trying to hit
Supervisor. Staff 3 denied witnessing Supervisor swing or punch
Youth A. She said Youth A was the one hitting himself in the face.
Staff 3 said Supervisor and Staff 1 attempted to restrain Youth A
but were unsuccessful and Youth A did fall to the floor. She could
not say for sure if Youth A was held down on the floor, because
Youth A was kicking and hitting staff while he was on the floor.
Supervisor reported Youth A was the one that attacked and
assaulted him, by punching, hitting, and biting and Youth A
punched Supervisor multiple times and at one point he did push
Youth A to prevent Youth A from hitting him. Supervisor denied
punching Youth A in the face but admitted that he did push Youth
A when Youth A was assaulting him.
Manager reported on the day in question Youth A became upset
and physically and verbally assaultive towards staff. Youth A was
punching, kicking, and biting staff members. Supervisor attempted
to verbally de-escalate Youth A. Manager called for assistance,
7

and Supervisor, Staff 1 and Staff 2 came to assist. Supervisor
was attempting to verbally de-escalate Youth A, however Youth
continued to be aggressive, ran up Supervisor and punched him
several times in the face, and Supervisor did push Youth A to
prevent Youth A from hitting Supervisor. Manager attempted to
counsel Youth A but was unsuccessful. Supervisor and Staff 1
attempted to put Youth A in a one arm hold, but he slipped out of
the hold and fell to the floor. Youth A started kicking, hitting, and
biting staff. She said once Youth A calmed down, he was escorted
to his bedroom. She denied witnessing Supervisor punch or hit
Youth A. She said Youth A was the one punching himself in the
face.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of POD D on 06/22/2025 at approximately 7:20 pm
was reviewed on 07/16/2025 (note: video does not have audio).
Staff 1 and Youth A are standing by the pod door. Youth A
appears agitated, pacing back and forth, and throwing broken
ceiling tiles. Staff 1 and Supervisor appear to be trying to talk to
Youth A. Youth A runs to Supervisor and punches Supervisor
several times. Supervisor pushes Youth A away from him. Youth
A continues to go toward Supervisor, trying to assault Supervisor.
Manager stands in between Youth A and Supervisor blocking
Youth A from assaulting Supervisor. Youth A swings and punches
Supervisor in the head, Supervisor swings and attempts to punch
Youth A, but does not make contact with Youth A. Supervisor,
Staff 1, and Staff 2, attempt to restrain Youth A, however Youth A
slips away and gets out of the restrain. Youth A drops to the floor
and Supervisor and Staff 1 hold Youth A on the floor for
approximately 30 seconds.
Documents Reviewed:
• Unusual Incident report dated 06/22/2025, written by
Manager. Report was consistent with manager’s interviews.
• Agency Discipline and Behavior Modification Policy:
prohibits cruel and unusual punishment including all the
following: Any type of physical discipline; The use of
excessive Chemical, Mechanical, or Physical Restraint;
Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
• Medical assessment dated 06/23/2025 completed by
Nurse. Youth A was examined due to hitting himself in the
face. Youth A had a small bruise on the right cheek.
• Supervisor’s personnel file: On 06/22/2025 Supervisor
violated the prohibited conduct policy inappropriate child
8

handling technique and behavior management. Supervisor
was terminated effective 06/25/2025.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance based on staff and youth
interviews, and video footage, staff pushed Youth A, which is a
prohibited form of discipline.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2023C0000437 dated 6/07/23, CAP approved 7/10/2023
SIR 2023C0000650SI dated 9/08/23, CAP approved 9/20/23
SIR 2023C0000773SI dated 10/26/2023, CAP approved
12/06/23 SIR 2023C0000787SI dated 12/19/23, CAP approved
2/02/24
SIR 2024SIC0001654 dated 09/19/24, CAP approved 1/24/25
SIR 2025SIC0000089 dated 01/09/25, CAP approved 1/29/25
SIR 2025SIC0000031 dated 01/09/25, CAP 3/17/25
SIR 2025SIC0000259 dated 04/10/25, CAP approved 5/16/25.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention;
Description prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
(5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the
severity of the youth's behavior, chronological and
developmental age, size, gender, physical condition, medical
condition, psychiatric condition, and personal history, including
any history of trauma, and must be done in a manner
consistent with the youth's treatment plan.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth A was restrained on the floor.
Investigation Chief Administrator reported video footage was reviewed, and
Manager did not follow the agency behavior management policy.
She said Manager was in charge and did not manage this
situation appropriately. Staff 1 and Supervisor did not use the
appropriate restraint while managing Youth A.
Youth A reported on the day in question he was restrained by
staff; however, he could not identify the staff members that
restrained him. Youth A could not recall what happened or how he
was restrained and refused to answer any other questions.
Staff 1 reported Youth A was escalated and out of control. Youth
A was assaulting staff and hitting himself. He reported several
attempts were made to restrain Youth A, but they were
unsuccessful. Youth A did fall on the floor while attempting to
9

restrain him but does not recall Youth A was restrained on the
floor.
Staff 2 reported Youth A was out of control, attacking Supervisor,
throwing chairs, and hitting himself. An attempt was made to
restrain Youth A; however, Supervisor and Staff 1 were
unsuccessful due to Youth A slipping through the hold. Staff 2
does not recall if Youth A was restrained on the floor.
Staff 3 reported there was a lot going on with Youth A and several
attempts were made to restrain him. Youth A was hitting himself
and Youth A did fall on the floor, however Staff 3 could not recall if
Youth A was restrained when he fell to the floor.
Nurse reported she examined Youth A on 06/23/2025 and he did
not disclose he was restrained on the floor.
Youth B and Youth C denied witnessing Youth A being
restrained on the floor.
Supervisor reported he and Staff 1 were trying to verbally de-
escalate Youth A, however Youth A was assaulting him and Staff
1. He and Staff 1 attempted to restrain and escort Youth A to his
room, but Youth A was kicking, punching, and trying to bite them.
Youth A buckled and dropped to the floor and that’s when he and
Staff 1 fall on the floor with Youth A. Supervisor does not recall
holding Youth A on the floor, but said a lot was happening so he
does not recall if Youth A was held down on the floor.
Manager reported she could not recall if Youth A was restrained
when he fell to the floor.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of POD D on 06/22/2025 at approximately 7:20 pm
was reviewed on 07/16/2025 (note: video does not have audio).
Staff 1 and Youth A are standing by the pod door. Youth A
appears agitated, pacing back and forth, and throwing broken
ceiling tiles. Staff 1 and Supervisor appear to be trying to talk to
Youth A. Youth A runs up to Supervisor and punches Supervisor
several times. Supervisor pushes Youth A away from him. Youth
A continues to come at Supervisor trying to assault Supervisor.
Manager stands in between Youth A and Supervisor blocking
Youth A from assaulting Supervisor. Youth A swings and punches
Supervisor in the head, Supervisor swings and attempts to punch
Youth A, but does not make contact with Youth A. Supervisor,
Staff 1, and Staff 2, attempt to restrain Youth A, however Youth A
10

slips away and gets out of the restrain. Youth A drops to the floor,
laying on his back, Supervisor and Staff 1 drop to the floor on top
of Youth A, Supervisor and Staff 1 lay partially on each side of
Youth A holding him down by his arm for approximately 30
seconds.
Document Reviewed:
• Agency Behavior Management System, Behavioral
Interventions Techniques, Safe Physical Interventions
(Youth Restraint) & Use of Seclusion Rooms Policy: Safe
Physical Intervention Techniques (Youth Restraint) 1. In
situations in which verbal and non-physical forms of crisis
interventions are not successful in diffusing harmful or
dangerous behaviors, the use of safe physical interventions
is allowed: A safe physical intervention shall be used only
as a last resort, after all other methods of non-physical
intervention have been exhausted. Safe physical
intervention techniques should be used for the minimum
length of time necessary to secure and restore safety to the
youth and others; 3. Only the approved SJJS safe physical
management techniques may be used.
• There are no approved floor restraints within the MANDT
training guide.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance based on staff interviews
and video footage. Staff performed a floor restraint, which is
outside of the agency restraint policy and MANDT training guide.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2025SIC0000259 dated 4/10/25, CAP approved 5/16/25
SIR 2025SIC0000290 dated 3/21/25, CAP approved 3/31/25
SIR 2024C0000854SI dated 12/6/23, CAP approved 1/18/24
SIR 2023C0000773SI dated 10/26/23, CAP approved 12/6/23
11

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
August 18, 2025
____________________________________________________________________
Nabiha Rizk Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
August 26, 2025

Area Manager
12
